title: Looking for nice freeware rounded fonts
content:
Hi everyone,

I’ve just discovered this board and realized it is a fountain of resources and I plan on visiting it daily. I have a question about a typeface that hopefully someone will be able to answer for me.

I have always liked rounded fonts, however have been unable to find some nice free ones. Unfortunatley I don’t have endless funds just yet to buy a lot of fonts, so does anyone have any advice for me to find some free licensed rounded style fonts?

Second question is:

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/dailypoetics/134930823/in/set-7205759410438...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080429225018/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/dailypoetics/134930823/in/set-72057594104389710/ "http://www.flickr.com/photos/dailypoetics/134930823/in/set-72057594104389710/")

What is the font featured in the “modi” logo in the above photo?

Thanks a lot!

James

 [‹ (x) Meshell Ndegeocello "The world has made me…" album cover - Big Caslon {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080429225018/http:/typophile.com/node/38942 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "True" logo solid sans - Franklin Gothic {Brandon S} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080429225018/http:/typophile.com/node/38938 "Go to next forum topic")
author: nein

comments.content:
Second question:  
looks like [Akzidenz Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20080429225018/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/akzidenz-grotesk-bq/) to me.

and could be [Chalet London 1970](http://web.archive.org/web/20080429225018/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=4) for ‘modi’. The i-dot is alterd?

EDIT:  
_What is the font featured in the “modi” logo in the above photo?_

Sorry, I had not read it. So I answerd about the small letters at first.
Right on Akira. Thanks a lot!

\> _I have always liked rounded fonts, however have been unable to find some nice free ones. Unfortunatley I don’t have endless funds just yet to buy a lot of fonts, so does anyone have any advice for me to find some free licensed rounded style fonts?_

Check DaFont, you’ll probably find some there. But don’t come complaining afterwards that they only have a limited character set, poor spacing and don’t perform very well. There _is_ a reason why almost all proper fonts need to be paid for. Maybe read these, and come back next week for the issue of spacing.

[An Introduction to Type design | The Type Designer as Artist](http://web.archive.org/web/20080429225018/http:/www.fontshop.be/details.php?entry=161)  
 [An Introduction to Type design | The Type Designer as Craftsman](http://web.archive.org/web/20080429225018/http:/www.fontshop.be/details.php?entry=230)
